questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'incessant'?
questions.explanation: Incessant means continuous, without stopping; 'intermittent' means stopping and starting at intervals.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'trenchant'?
questions.explanation: Trenchant means sharp and clearly effective; 'vague' means unclear and imprecise.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'listless'?
questions.explanation: Listless means lacking energy; 'energetic' is the direct opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'disparage'?
questions.explanation: Disparage means to belittle; 'praise' is to speak highly of.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'impetuous'?
questions.explanation: Impetuous means acting quickly without thought; 'deliberate' means done carefully and intentionally.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'covert'?
questions.explanation: Covert means hidden; 'overt' means done openly and clearly.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'inert'?
questions.explanation: Inert means lacking the ability to move or act; 'active' is the core opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'spurious'?
questions.explanation: Spurious means false or fake; 'genuine' means real and authentic.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'convoluted'?
questions.explanation: Convoluted means extremely complex; 'simple' is the strongest antonym.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'antedated'?
questions.explanation: To antedate is to come before in time; 'postdate' means to come after in time.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'exacting'?
questions.explanation: Exacting means demanding great effort; 'lenient' implies less demand and more tolerance.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'fortuitous'?
questions.explanation: Fortuitous means happening by chance; 'intentional' means done on purpose.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'glib'?
questions.explanation: Glib speech is smooth and insincere; 'halting' speech is hesitant, the opposite of smooth fluency.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'improvident'?
questions.explanation: Improvident means not planning for the future; 'prudent' means showing good judgment and foresight.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'jubilant'?
questions.explanation: Jubilant means extremely joyful; 'somber' means serious and gloomy.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'obdurate'?
questions.explanation: Obdurate means stubbornly refusing to change; 'yielding' means ready to give way.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'pellucid'?
questions.explanation: Pellucid means very clear; 'opaque' means not transparent or hard to understand.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'quiescent'?
questions.explanation: Quiescent means inactive or at rest; 'active' is the core opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rescind'?
questions.explanation: Rescind means to cancel or revoke; 'uphold' means to maintain or support.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'salient'?
questions.explanation: Salient means most noticeable or important; 'obscure' means not clearly seen or known.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'sanguine'?
questions.explanation: Sanguine means hopeful or optimistic; 'pessimistic' means expecting the worst.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'stoic'?
questions.explanation: Stoic means enduring pain without showing emotion; 'emotional' implies openly showing feelings.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'tantamount'?
questions.explanation: Tantamount means equivalent in effect; 'different from' signals non-equivalence.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'trite'?
questions.explanation: Trite means overused and unoriginal; 'original' is the conceptual opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'vindictive'?
questions.explanation: Vindictive means seeking revenge; 'forgiving' means willing to let go of resentment.
